  "title": "Job Vacancies at Nordica Fertility Clinic",
  "description": "Nordica Fertility Clinic, a foremost clinic in the matters of fertility treatment, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)&nbsp;Embryologist Trainee

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Operational Responsibilities
Lab Maintenance:


	Perform daily cleaning and maintenance of the embryology lab, ensuring a sterile and organized environment.
	Clean and maintain the andrology and serology workbench to meet the highest standards of hygiene.


Dish Preparation:


	
	Prepare culture dishes 24 hours before treatments to facilitate successful embryo development.
	


Egg Pickup Preparation:


	
	Prepare the lab for egg pickup procedures, ensuring all equipment and supplies are in order.
	


Monitoring and Documentation:


	Regularly monitor temperature, CO2 levels, and volatile organic compound (VOC) levels in the lab.
	Conduct routine serology tests and seminal fluid analysis as required.
	Document serology and seminal fluid analysis results accurately.


Reporting and Communication:


	Present weekly and monthly laboratory activities and findings to the relevant team members.
	Prepare and dispatch treatment summaries after embryo transfers.
	Maintain open communication and timely reporting.


Inventory Management:


	Take weekly and monthly stock of all consumables, ensuring an adequate supply for ongoing treatments.
	Send stock reports to the appropriate departments.


Result Preparation and Dispatch:


	
	Prepare daily results and ensure their prompt dispatch to the front desk for patient updates.
	


Assisted Reproductive Procedures:


	
	Perform assisted reproductive procedures, including Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection (ICSI), Intracytoplasmic Morphologically Selected Sperm Injection (IMSI), Physiologically-Induced Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection (PICSI), and Laser-Assisted Hatching (LAH).
	


Embryo Management:


	Conduct vitrification and thawing of embryos, ensuring their safety and viability.
	Perform embryo biopsy and tubing as needed.
	Assist in sending samples for genetic screening, if required.
	Vitrify and thaw oocytes and embryos as part of the treatment process.


Strategic Responsibilities:
Professional Development:


	Stay updated on the latest developments in the field of embryology by attending conferences, workshops, and regularly reviewing scientific journals.
	Make suggestions for the adoption of new treatment types, methods, or systems to enhance patient care.


Image Projection:


	
	Contribute to building and projecting a positive image of the clinic within professional and patient communities.
	


Learning and Growth:


	Invest in personal and team learning and growth.
	Promote the use of technology and motivate colleagues to be accountable individuals with a strong sense of integrity.


Information Accuracy:


	
	Ensure that information provided to colleagues, patients, and the general public within the area of responsibility is accurate, appropriate, and aligned with ethical standards.
	


Job Requirements
To be successful in the role, the candidates should meet the following requirements:

Education:


	
	Possess a minimum of a BSc.
	


Experience:


	
	Minimum of 2years&rsquo; relevant work experience.
	


Technical Competencies:


	Proficient in laboratory management.
	Sound knowledge of the IVF techniques.


Competencies:


	Pro-activeness and alertness
	Teamwork
	Creativity
	Integrity
	Problem Analysis
	Process Improvement


Behavioural Competencies:


	High Energy Level
	Good verbal and written communication
	Good leadership and motivational skills
	Honesty
	Customer Orientation
	Attention to detail
	Strong organizational skills, confident, friendly &amp; approachable


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@nordicalagos.org&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

2.)&nbsp;Medical Laboratory Scientist

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Laboratory Scientist to join our team.
	The successful candidate will perform a variety of laboratory tests and procedures to assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.
	This role requires strong analytical skills, a commitment to accuracy, and strict adherence to safety and quality standards.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Medical Laboratory Science.
	Experience: Minimum 3- 5 years of experience in a clinical role.
	Certification: Certification by an accredited professional body (BMLS).
	Proficient in laboratory techniques, instrumentation, and data analysis.
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
	Effective communication skills and ability to work independently or as part of a team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@nordicalagos.org&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Applicants must reside within Surulere and its environs and must be available to resume immediately.

&nbsp;

&nbsp;

3.)&nbsp;Senior Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly skilled Senior Accountant to join our finance team.
	The Senior Accountant will play a key role in overseeing the day-to-day accounting functions, preparing financial statements, managing general ledger entries, and ensuring compliance with accounting standards and regulations.
	This position requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Reporting &amp; Analysis:


	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in accordance with accounting principles.
	Conduct variance analysis and report any discrepancies or trends to senior management.
	Review and analyze financial data, ensuring accuracy and completeness.


General Ledger Management:


	Over see general ledger (GL) entries and ensure proper account classification.
	Reconcile all general ledger accounts and investigate any discrepancies.
	Ensure proper allocation of costs to appropriate accounts and departments.


Cash Flow Management:


	Over see cash flow management and ensure efficient cash position for the company.
	Monitor accounts payable and accounts receivable activities and report on aging


Tax &amp; Compliance:


	Prepare and file tax returns in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
	Work with auditors during annual audits to ensure financial statements are prepared and ready for review.
	Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant local, state, and national regulations.


Internal Controls:


	Design and implement internal control procedures to ensure financial integrity and mitigate risks.
	Review and improve accounting procedures to ensure efficiency and accuracy.


Budgeting &amp; Forecasting:


	Prepare and monitor budgets, helping senior management with financial projections.
	Assist in the preparation of financial forecasts based on company needs and market conditions.
	Assist in improving accounting processes and systems to enhance efficiency.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Accounting or Finance
	Minimum of 4 - 7 years of progressive accounting experience
	Professional certification (e.g.,ICAN, ACA,e.t.c) is required
	Strong knowledge of accounting standards, taxlaws, and financial regulations.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g.,QuickBooks, SAP,SAGE, orERPsystems)
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and leadership skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@nordicalagos.org&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "description": "TM Interiors is a premier full-service interior design and building finish firm, specializing in Architectural Design Consultation, Interior Design Services, and turn-key Building/Carcass finishing. Our meticulous design process prioritizes client desires with a keen awareness of timelines and budgets.

Creativity propels TMIA, underscored by our core values: CAMARADERIE, COLLABORATION, and TRANSPARENCY. Our team comprises passionate individuals dedicated to upholding our high standards, ensuring success for every project over time.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos

About the Job


	We are seeking a highly organized, mature, and reliable individual to join our growing design and creative operations team as an Administrative &amp; Accounts Officer.
	This role requires a proactive professional with strong administrative competence, basic accounting skills, and the ability to engage with clients, vendors, and internal teams with diplomacy and efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage daily office activities, communications, and scheduling
	Maintain an orderly and professional environment, ensuring smooth workflow across departments
	Handle procurement coordination and oversee inventory of office and project materials
	Coordinate logistics for meetings, internal events, and team planning
	Track all inflow and outflow of funds using accounting software or spreadsheets
	Generate and update financial records including receipts, invoices, and payment schedules
	Support monthly expense reporting and budget tracking
	Work with external accountants to ensure compliance with all tax and statutory obligations
	Serve as the first point of contact for general enquiries, resolving issues quickly and tactfully
	Support workspace organization, ensuring orderliness and functionality at all times
	Collaborate with leadership to implement new operational systems as the business expands


Requirements


	A minimum of 3&ndash;5 years of experience in a similar administrative/accounting role
	Strong interpersonal skills and a calm, solution-oriented mindset
	High level of maturity, discretion, and professionalism
	Working knowledge of basic bookkeeping and Excel (QuickBooks or similar tools is a plus)
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and operate independently


You&rsquo;ll Thrive In This Role If You Are:


	Detail-oriented and organized, with a natural sense of responsibility
	Someone who values excellence and keeps things running smoothly behind the scenes
	Able to communicate with warmth and clarity across levels
	Emotionally intelligent, mature, and good with people management
	Passionate about helping teams stay focused and productive.


Method of Application

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

About the Job
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly organized, mature, and reliable individual to join our growing design and creative operations team as an Administrative & Accounts Officer.
	This role requires a proactive professional with strong administrative competence, basic accounting skills, and the ability to engage with clients, vendors, and internal teams with diplomacy and efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage daily office activities, communications, and scheduling
	Maintain an orderly and professional environment, ensuring smooth workflow across departments
	Handle procurement coordination and oversee inventory of office and project materials
	Coordinate logistics for meetings, internal events, and team planning
	Track all inflow and outflow of funds using accounting software or spreadsheets
	Generate and update financial records including receipts, invoices, and payment schedules
	Support monthly expense reporting and budget tracking
	Work with external accountants to ensure compliance with all tax and statutory obligations
	Serve as the first point of contact for general enquiries, resolving issues quickly and tactfully
	Support workspace organization, ensuring orderliness and functionality at all times
	Collaborate with leadership to implement new operational systems as the business expands


Requirements


	A minimum of 3–5 years of experience in a similar administrative/accounting role
	Strong interpersonal skills and a calm, solution-oriented mindset
	High level of maturity, discretion, and professionalism
	Working knowledge of basic bookkeeping and Excel (QuickBooks or similar tools is a plus)
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and operate independently


You’ll Thrive In This Role If You Are:


	Detail-oriented and organized, with a natural sense of responsibility
	Someone who values excellence and keeps things running smoothly behind the scenes
	Able to communicate with warmth and clarity across levels
	Emotionally intelligent, mature, and good with people management
	Passionate about helping teams stay focused and productive.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short Cover Letter to: hr@tmiworks.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Quality Control Officer Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Officer

Job Location: NASCON P-Salt village, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Responsible for ensuring all products meets internal and external requirements as well as exceeds customer expectation within allocated budget.


Responsibilities


	Ensure the QC operations team meets and/or exceeds performance standards and/or goals defined by management     .
	Manage the development and implementation of activities to maximize efficiency of staff and resources to support operational objective ensure safety standards and cleanliness of the laboratory are maintained.
	Determine staff training needs, coordinate, and provide appropriate training, certification, recertification and coaching responsible for undertaking operations necessary for quality testing within quality control.
	Ensure all QC instruments / methods / equipment are adequately validated, maintained, and calibrated.
	Supports and ensures effective, cross-functional teams that accomplish project objectives on a prescribed schedule and with a prescribed budget interpret test results, compare to established specification and control limit effective implementation of food safety management system overseeing processes such as non-conformance material, incoming and outgoing inspection, return material authorization, calibration, QC test to support release, characterization and stability testing of raw materials, production intermediates and final good.           


Requirements


	Excellent organizing and prioritizing skills.
	Problem solving skills.
	Able to work independently and meticulously.
	Ability to pay attention to detail and accuracy.
	Information management skills.
	Effective communication.


Experience: 


	B.sc/HND Chemistry, Biochemistry, Food Science/Tech. or other related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience.
